item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Tom Perrotta
item.description: "From a distance, it makes perfect sense that the people and the things you think will save you are the very ones that have the power to disappoint you most bitterly, but up close it can hit you as a bewildering surprise." -- Tom Perrotta

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "He doesn’t know to want for more because nothing in his life has been as much as this...on that night he thinks that no one has ever had so much and only later will he know he should have asked for more." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "The kind of love that offers its life so easily, so stupidly, is always the love that is not returned." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "For a man to know what he has when he had it, that is what makes him a fortunate man." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "In vain have I struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "You cannot protect yourself from sadness without protecting yourself from happiness." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "I don't want to repeat my innocence. I want the pleasure of losing it again." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Fiction is the truth inside the lie." -- Stephen King

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?" -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "There was such an incredible logic to kissing, such a metal-to-magnet pull between two people that it was a wonder that they found the strength to prevent themselves from succumbing every second. Rightfully, the world should be a whirlpool of kissing into which we sank and never found the strength to rise up again." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "There was no time for kissing but she wanted him to know that in the future there would be. A kiss in so much loneliness was like a hand pulling you up out of the water, scooping you up from a place of drowning and into the reckless abundance of air. A kiss, another kiss." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "She sang as if she was saving the life of every person in the room." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "Reading fiction is important. It is a vital means of imagining a life other than our own, which in turn makes us more empathetic beings. Following complex story lines stretches our brains beyond the 140 characters of sound-bite thinking, and staying within the world of a novel gives us the ability to be quiet and alone, two skills that are disappearing faster than the polar icecaps." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "We laugh and laugh, and nothing can ever be sad, no one can be lost, or dead, or far away: right now we are here, and nothing can mar our perfection, or steal the joy of this perfect moment." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Do you ever miss him? Every day. Every minute. Every minute, she says. Yes, it's that way, isn't it?" -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Marisha Pessl
item.description: "Not returning phone calls is the severest form of torture in the civilized world." -- Marisha Pessl

item.title: Frédérique add a quote by Marisha Pessl
item.description: "...I couldn't let go of the thought that it had, in fact, been he, restless and moody Heathcliff. Day after day, he floated through all the Wal-Marts in America, searching for me in a million lonely aisles." -- Marisha Pessl
